Undercroft: Crypt

Torches along the wall burn with a blue-green flame, casting flickering light over a row of
 sarcophagi — one of which appears broken from the inside, sending chills down your spine.
Ossuary

Skulls are stacked against the walls, while ribs and femurs knot together to shape the arches
 overhead — the hollow gazes from the skulls seem to follow your every step.
Sacristy

A large altar and ornate chests line the walls, though all have been desecrated and looted.
 Faint runes — written in what you can only assume is blood — crawl across the surfaces, their
 meaning unknowable yet deeply unsettling.
Candlelit vault

Every surface - tables, cupboards, even the floor - is filled with lit candles, their flames
 swaying gently yet never diminishing, distorting your perception of time until hours and days
 bleed into a single, unending moment.
Torture room

Racks, pillories, and an iron maiden fill the room, their surfaces stained and worn—either
 recently used, or perhaps it’s just this horrid place that preserves such horrors.
Prison cell

Rusted chains cling to the wall, and following their length, you come upon the crumpled remains
 of a skeleton — an unfortunate soul, long forgotten in this accursed place.
Tomb corridor

Long and dark corridor with sarcophagi on both sides each descecrated - or ordained? - with
 demonic scripture
Sewers: Cistern

A huge room with angle-high water, cold and damp, with constant dripping from the ceiling
    that forms stalactites and hints at the place’s ancient age.
Old baths
A room with small pools that are almost dried out and the sides are covered in slime.
Mossy well

You see in the middle of the room a well with a pulley and bucket for hoisting water from the
 underground.
Sewage junction

Here multiple tunnels meet and collect the water in a huge basin, with walkways along the edges
 of the room.
Storage room
The room has broken shelves and dusty crates scattered about. All are rotten and useless.
Overflow reservoir

A vast hollow chamber strethces into shadow, its walls marked by dark, wabering stains that show
 where the flood once reached. Massive sluice doors loom at the far end, chained shut, as if to
 hold back something worse than water.
Sewage passage

A large passage that collects the waste water from small holes and tunnels and leads it further
 down.
Mine: Ore storer
Here the ore was counted and stored before it was shipped out of the mine.
Old stope
An open area that once was covered in ore that now have been mined out.
Crew quarters
Beds and hammocks are scattered all over the place. It looks as though everyone left in a hurry.
Rusty hoist

There is a big shaft that goes down into a dark abyss. Next to it is hoist that seems so brittle
 that it would break if you tried to use it.
Mineshaft
A long tunnel with wooden boards as floor and timber beams are used to support the roof and walls.
Cartway
A long tunnel with metal rails across the floor used for moving minecarts with debris or ore.
Winze

A long tunnel that goes down at an angle, there is a hoist that can be used to move minecarts up
 and down.
Natural Cave: The cave expands into a big hollow room formed by an ancient dried up river.
Multiple small ponds play a soothing melody from the constant dripping of water from stalactites.

It seems like an unknown creature used to live here. There are corpse leftovers and remains from
 excrements.
Big crystals shine and sparkle in the low light of your torch.
Veins of metal flicker on the walls surrounding you signalling undiscovered ores.
Jagged and narrow walls lead deeper into the cave. The curves makes it hard to see how far it continues.
